properties.areaDesc: Northern Oxford; Coastal Cumberland; Southern Oxford; Kennebec; Southern Franklin; Sagadahoc; Northern Coos; Southern Somerset; Androscoggin; Central Somerset; Interior Cumberland; Northern Franklin
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 18 at 2:50PM EST until February 18 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
...SNOW CONTINUES THIS EVENING...

.Moderate to heavy snow has overspread much of the area this
afternoon and will continue into the evening for most. Two areas
of warmth are pushing into the region and will change parts of
southern New Hampshire and coastal western Maine to a rain or
wintry mix before precipitation comes to an end. Warmer air from
the ocean will move inland and change precipitation over to rain,
especially near the coast. At the same time warmer air aloft will
move north out of Massachusetts and turn precipitation to sleet or
possibly light freezing rain for a brief time before ending. Until
then snowfall rates may approach 1 inch per hour at times. Expect
precipitation to quickly end from southwest to northeast over the
mid to late evening hours.

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches for
a storm total of 3 to 5 inches.

* WHERE...Portions of northern New Hampshire and south central,
southwest, west central and western Maine.

* WHEN...Until 10 PM EST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on snow covered and slippery road conditions. The
hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Across southern parts of the advisory area
snow may mix with or change to sleet, freezing rain, or rain for
a time. Snowfall rates will approach 1 inch per hour at times
late this afternoon.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow...sleet...or
freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for
slippery roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while
driving.

For a more precise forecast for your specific location...go to
www.weather.gov/gray.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING
